signature: private static void addLookup(final DefaultStringLookup lookup, final Map<String, StringLookup> map)
name: addLookup
javadoc:
/**
 * Adds a string lookup to the provided map, using the key from the lookup as the map's key.
 * If the added lookup is {@link DefaultStringLookup#BASE64_DECODER}, it also adds an alias "base64" with the same value.
 *
 * @param lookup  the string lookup to add
 * @param map     the map of lookups to update
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Adds a string lookup to the provided map, using the key from the lookup as the map's key.
 * If the added lookup is {@link DefaultStringLookup#BASE64_DECODER}, it also adds an alias "base64" with the same value.
 *
 * @param lookup  the string lookup to add
 * @param map     the map of lookups to update
 */

signature: private static Map<String, StringLookup> parseStringLookups(final String str)
name: parseStringLookups
javadoc:
/**
 * Parses a comma-separated list of string lookups and returns a map of lookup names to their corresponding StringLookup instances.
 *
 * @param str A comma-separated list of string lookups, where each lookup is specified by its name in uppercase (e.g. "lookup1,lookup2,lookup3").
 * @return A map of lookup names to their corresponding StringLookup instances.
 * @throws IllegalArgumentException If the input string contains invalid or unknown lookup names.
 */
improved_javadoc: INVALID FORMAT

signature: static <K, V> Map<K, V> toMap(final Map<K, V> map)
name: toMap
javadoc:
/**
 * Converts a given {@code Map} instance to another one.
 *
 * If the input map is {@code null}, an empty map is returned. Otherwise,
 * the original map is returned as is.
 *
 * @param map the input map to be converted
 * @return the converted map, or an empty map if the input was {@code null}
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Converts a given Map instance to another one by creating a defensive copy.
 *
 * If the input map is null, this method returns an empty map. Otherwise,
 * it returns a new map containing all entries from the original map.
 *
 * @param map the input map to be converted
 * @return the converted map, or an empty map if the input was null
 */

 * @return A new instance of {@link BiStringLookup} based on the provided bi-function.
 */

name: constantStringLookup

/**
 * Returns a singleton instance of the {@code ConstantStringLookup} class.
 * This method ensures that only one instance of the lookup is created,
 * and subsequent calls return the same instance.

 */

name: dateStringLookup

 * Returns a single, shared instance of the {@link DateStringLookup} class.

 * and provides access to it. The instance is lazily initialized on first call.
 *
 * @return A singleton instance of {@link DateStringLookup}
 */

signature: public <R> StringLookup functionStringLookup(final Function<String, R> function)
name: functionStringLookup
javadoc:
/**
 * Creates a string lookup from a given function.
 *
 * @param function The function to create a string lookup from. It must map strings to objects of type R.
 * @return A string lookup that can be used to look up values in the provided function.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Creates a string lookup from a given function, mapping each input string to its corresponding output object of type R.
 *
 * @param <R> The type of objects returned by the function for each input string.
 * @param function The function to create a string lookup from. It must map strings to objects of type R.
 * @return A string lookup that can be used to look up values in the provided function, where each key is an input string and each value is its corresponding output object.
 */

name: propertiesStringLookup
javadoc:
/**
 * Creates a string lookup instance that uses properties files for data.
 *
 * @param fences The paths to the properties files, which can be used as a fallback if the primary
 *               configuration is not found. Can be empty if no fallbacks are needed.
 * @return A new instance of PropertiesStringLookup.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Creates a string lookup instance that uses properties files for data, providing a flexible and
 * configurable way to resolve strings in the application context. This method allows specifying one
 * or more fallback configuration files, which can be used if the primary configuration file is not
 * found.
 *
 * @param fences The paths to the properties files, which can be used as a fallback if the primary
 *               configuration is not found. Can be empty if no fallbacks are needed.
 * @return A new instance of PropertiesStringLookup, initialized with the specified configuration files.
 */

signature: public StringLookup xmlStringLookup(final Map<String, Boolean> xPathFactoryFeatures, final Path... fences)
name: xmlStringLookup
javadoc:
/**
 * Creates a new instance of XmlStringLookup.
 *
 * @param xPathFactoryFeatures A map of XPath factory features to be used in the lookup.
 * @param fences One or more path objects that define the scope of the lookup.
 * @return A new instance of XmlStringLookup.
 */

/**
 * Creates a new instance of XmlStringLookup, initializing it with the specified XPath factory features and scope boundaries defined by the provided fences.

 * @param xPathFactoryFeatures A map of XPath factory features to be used in the lookup, such as namespace mappings or function libraries.
 * @param fences One or more path objects that define the scope of the lookup, including start and end points for the search.
 * @return A new instance of XmlStringLookup, ready for use in resolving XML string lookups within the specified scope.
 */
